title: Robert Sassone (cyclist)
text:
Robert Sassone (23 November 1978 – 21 January 2016) was a French <a href="bicycle%20racing">racing cyclist</a>. He had cancer and took his own life.
He rode in the <a href="Cycling%20at%20the%202000%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Madison">men's Madison</a> at the <a href="2000%20Summer%20Olympics">2000 Summer Olympics</a>. He also rode in the <a href="2002%20Vuelta%20a%20Espa%C3%B1a">2002 Vuelta a España</a>, finishing in 129th place. He was banned from cycling for two years in 2004, after testing positive for <a href="betamethasone">betamethasone</a> during the Six Days of Nouméa race in <a href="New%20Caledonia">New Caledonia</a>.
Death.
Sassone was suffering from cancer and took his own life in his native New Caledonia in January 2016, aged 37.
